lines.text: Id better go pack.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh no, I already packed. The only thing I couldnt find though was your Speedo.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: A Speedo? Uh, I dont have a Speedo. Im gonna go pack my regular long bathing suit.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh good youre still here!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I want to tell you to have a good honeymoon!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And I also wanted you guys to know that I am telling the father today.  What? What? What?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: We know its Ross!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: How?! How do you know?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: It was his sweater, butOh my God!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, I so wanted Ross to know first, but Im so relieved you guys know.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is so great! And Im gonna be your babys aunt!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I know!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Me too!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Im gonna be an uncle! Come here!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Youre all gonna be aunts and uncles.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, but Im the only one related by blood.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay. Great! So now that you guys all know you can help me. Give me some advice on how Im gonna tell Ross!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, what were you gonna say?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well I was gonna tell him that Im-Im gonna have the baby and he can be as involved as he wants.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well that, that sounds good.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah but how do I start? I mean, whats-whats the first thing that I say?  Okay great! Thanks.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey! Good luck!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, bye.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey, what was that all about?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well I guess there is no harm in telling you now, Rachel and Ross are gonna have a baby.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What?! I didnt even know thatWhy didnt you tell me?!  Why am I talking like this?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I didnt think you could keep it a secret.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What?!  I am an excellent secret keeper. I have kept all of our secrets.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What secrets?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh no-no Joey, I am not going to tell you because I am an excellent secret keeper.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Youll tell me later?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You already know.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, it's so romantic to send people off on their honeymoon.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yknow, Monica and Chandler are married. Ross and Rachel are having a baby. Maybe you and I should do something.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: All in good time my love. All in good time. Oh shoot! I left my guitar in their apartment. Well you can let me in later.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I dont have a key, they took mine to give to you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?! They took mine to give to you!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Why would they take away our keys?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Maybe they dont trust us.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No thats not it. They let me keep my key the last time they were out of town.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You mean the time you broke the ketchup bottle and cleaned it up with Monicas guest towels?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, I washed those!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No you didnt.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah that didnt sound like me.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, what am I gonna do? I really need my guitar!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, I have stuff in there too.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What stuff?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Monicas chicken parm! Ill take care of it.  Hey Mr. Treeger, its Joey Tribbiani. Listen, I need to get into Monica and Chandlers apartment. Its an emergency.  Uhh, gas leak! Yeah oh, and bring garlic bread.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Did Rachel find you?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No why?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh she was looking for you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh well, I guess Ill catch up with her later.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, she really wanted to talk to you now.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, it seemed pretty important.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I think I might know what this is about.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah. Uh, uh we promised we werent gonna tell anybody this but uh, about a month ago Rachel and I slept together.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: And?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wow! I thought you would be a little more shocked.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh sorry.  And?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, we-we said wed just do it that one time but, but now I think she may wanna start things up again.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, I dont think thats what it is.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Why? What-what else could it be?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh wow, I dont feel well.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Im telling you. Im telling you. Thats what it is. No wonder she was looking at me all funny during the wedding. She didnt say anything to you?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Maybe its something you ate?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Please, just-just, just go and talk to Rachel.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, I guess I should.  Man, yknow what I have to realize? Maybe Im just not the type of guy women can have just one night with. Yknow, they-they always seem to want a little bit more. I should remember that.

lines.speaker: ticket agent
lines.text: Next?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Theyre kissing lets just go around them.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh honey, leave them alone, theyre in love.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Im in love too! But in an orderly fashion.

lines.speaker: ticket agent
lines.text: Next?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi! Can you do that and walk? Cause she said, "Next."

lines.speaker: woman
lines.text: Sorry. We didnt hear you; were on our honeymoon.

lines.speaker: ticket agent
lines.text: Oh, let me see what I can do.  There are some first class seats available.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Did you hear that?! They bumped them up to first class because they are on their honeymoon! Come on! Lets act like were on our honeymoon.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: We are on our honeymoon.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Grab my ass!

lines.speaker: ticket agent
lines.text: Next?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi, sorry. I almost didnt hear you, because yknow Im just so in love with my new husband. Were on our honeymoon.

lines.speaker: ticket agent
lines.text: Congratulations. Okay, Mr. Bing youll be in 25J and Mrs. Bing youll be in 25K.

lines.text: Oh no, you see were on our honeymoon. So umm, can you do your little thing and bump us up to first class?

lines.speaker: ticket agent
lines.text: Im sorry, all our first class seats are taken. That couple got the last two.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You see, if wed gone around them like I said, weShe wouldve given us those tickets. Damnit!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: 25J and K, any chance those arent together?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I still cant believe they took away my key. You trust me with yours.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Of course I do! And Im gonna give it back to you as soon as theyre done with it at the key shining place.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What the hell is that?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! Treeger, what are you doing?

lines.speaker: mr. treeger
lines.text: You said there was a gas leak in here.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well why dont you use your key?

lines.speaker: mr. treeger
lines.text: Because by the time I find it on this thing , the whole place might have exploded. If that happens at another building that I manage, people are gonna start asking questions.  Come on! Hurry up.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh! We could have done that.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Look at that! Look at that! Theyre going into the first class lounge! Do you know what they have in there?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Me neither! We have to get in!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Just act like you belong.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God! Oranges!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Shh!  Nice to see you again.

lines.speaker: airline employee
lines.text: Uh sir, may I see your tickets please?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes, of course.

lines.speaker: airline employee
lines.text: Im sorry, would you move your thumb? I cant see the seat number.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh thats all right, I have it memorized. Its 1A.

lines.speaker: airline employee
lines.text: Sir, this is not a first class ticket. Im sorry.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Apology accepted. Excuse us.

lines.speaker: airline employee
lines.text: Sir! Im afraid Im gonna have to ask you to leave.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Fine.  Go! Go! Go!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.text: Hi.

lines.text: Hi.  Umm, I think theres something that we really need to talk about.

lines.text: I think we do. Why dont we go inside?  Look uh, I know why youre here.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You do?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, and to save you from any embarrassment umm, I think maybe I should talk first.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay.  Uh, Ross and Rachel. Rachel and Ross. Thats been one heck of a see-saw hasnt it?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I mean look, that-that one night we had was fun and and certainly passionate, but dont you think its better if we just stayed friends?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Seriously. What?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay. Okay. Yknow what? If you want to, we can do it one more time. I mean Id-Id be okay with that. In fact, I have some time right now.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, yknow what? Can I, can I talk now?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh sure.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im pregnant.  Ross?  Ross?  Okay, whenever youre ready.  And youre the father by the waybut you got that

lines.text: Can I get you some water?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Im good. Im good.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ross, there is no pressure on you. Okay? I mean you can as involved as you want.

lines.text: Yeah, I need uh Im justI dont knowI dont understand, umm, how this happened? We-we used a condom.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I know. I know, but yknow condoms only work like 97% of the time.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What? What? What?!! Well they should put that on the box!!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: They do!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No they dont!!!  Well they should put it in huge black letters!!!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay Ross come on lets just forget about the condoms.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh well I may as well have!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Listen, yknow what? I was really freaked out too when I found out

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Freaked out? Hey no, Im not freaked out! Im indignant! As a consumer!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yknow what? Lets, lets talk later.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No! No! I want to talk now! Okay? IIn fact,  I am going to talk to the president of the condom company!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, yknow maybe I should come back

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Shh! Shh! Shh!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah Ill press 1!

lines.speaker: mr. treeger
lines.text: Ive looked everywhere. Theres no gas leak.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Huh. So then I can heat this up?

lines.speaker: mr. treeger
lines.text: Anyway uh, Ill get moving on that new door.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh great! And listen, could you do us a favor and not tell Chandler and Monica about this? Cause yknow umm, they dont-they dont have any kids of their own and-and this door was like a child to them.

lines.speaker: mr. treeger
lines.text: Well Im gonna have to put on a new lock, theyll find out anyway.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.speaker: mr. treeger
lines.text: Whoa! This looks like an all day job, Ill have to cancel my yoga class.  Hey Ross!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hi.

lines.text: Could you tell Jasmine that I won't make it to yoga class today?

lines.text: Sure.

lines.speaker: mr. treeger

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Namaste.

lines.text: Oh my God! What happened to the door?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So its noticeable huh?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look, is Rachel here? I really need to talk to her.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Didnt you two already talk?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah but uh Okay, okay look you guys know that Rachel and I slept together, but theres something else.  Rachels pregnant.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh my God!!! I cant believe that!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Holy mother of God!!!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: With my child.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: That is brand new information!!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You already know dont you?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: A little bit.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: How are you doing?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay. Okay. I mean Ill be okay. Its just I dont think I handled it very well.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, what did you say to her?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Nothing. But the complaint department at the condom company got an earful. And then when I turned around she was gone.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh Ross.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: But hey, in my defense I-I just found out condoms are like only 97% effective.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I gotta go find her.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Whoa! Hey! Whoa!! Hold up! Are you serious?! So like 3% of the time they dont even work?! Huh? They should put that on the box!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Evidently they do.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I cant believe were here.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh youve got to be kidding me.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: front desk clerk
lines.text: As a wedding gift to you, the hotel would like to give you the honeymoon suite.

lines.text: No!! You have been screwing us all day!

lines.speaker: man
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Were you just ten seconds later!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah! You already got the first class tickets; you got the lounge! I mean we should get free stuff too! I mean youre not the only ones on your honeymoon!

lines.speaker: woman
lines.text: Well you can have the suite if you want. We dont care about where we stay. Were here to celebrate our love together. We dont have to get free stuff. We just want to be together.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: We need the stuff.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey Monica its Joey. Listen uh, Phoebe and I smell gas comin from your apartment.

lines.text: What? Are you serious?!  Joey smells gas!

lines.text: What else is new?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah and wed go check it out, but you took away our keys.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well do something! Get in there!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: How? I guess I could break down your door.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah! Do that!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And-and you wont blame us for any damage?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No!  Are you doing it?! I dont hear anything! Come on!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh, okay Ill-Ill-Ill break it down.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh hey hi, hes doing it. Hes breaking down the door.  Okay, were in.

lines.speaker: nurse
lines.text: Okay Rachel, are you comfortable?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: If I said I was, would you judge me?

lines.speaker: nurse
lines.text: The doctor will be here in a minute to do your sonogram.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay.  Oh man, I swear if they sold these at Pottery Barn

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh we-we need to talk.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Uh-uh-uh, right now? Because Ive kinda got an el fresco situation going on over here.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Please, please I want to apologize for the way I acted earlier today.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay Ross thats fine, but can you please stand near my head?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What? Oh yeah.  Im sorry. I mean I-I think I went a little crazy. I mean I was thinking about myself when I  reallyI should have been thinking about you Rach

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay. Head Ross! Head Ross! Head Ross!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Right! Right! I justI want you to know that Im going to be there through this whole thing, okay? Okay? The doctors appointments, the uh, the Lamaze classes, uh baby-proofing the apartmentAlthough we could probably worry about that til after we get married.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What married?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well yeah, I think we should get married.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What, because thats your answer to everything?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, because thats the right thing to do.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, maybe if youre in love. But Ross, we are not in love, are we?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No but but still you cant possibly do this alone.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Come on Rach, you cant even eat alone in a restaurant.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Im just saying if you cant eat by yourself, how do you expect to have a baby by yourself?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I can too eat by myself!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: When have you ever?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: When certain people leave the table and I am not finished!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well certain other people take two hours to eat a bowl of soup!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh please, you inhale your food!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I grew up with Monica! If you didnt eat fast you didnt eat!!

lines.text: Am I interrupting?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh no Dr. Long, please come in. This is Ross, he is the father.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: But not the husband, because evidently she can do this alone.

lines.speaker: dr. long
lines.text: Huh. Nice to meet you. Ill get started on this.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I dont know why you cant admit that you need me.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I do need you! I need you to stand near my head!

lines.speaker: dr. long
lines.text: Okay, everything looks good. Here it is on the screen.  Here is your uterus. And right here is your baby.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wow. There it is, I see it.

lines.speaker: dr. long
lines.text: Congratulations. Ill give you two a minute.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Pretty amazing huh?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I dont see it!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What? What?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I cant see it!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You-you just said that you did!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I know, I lied! I didnt want her to think I was a terrible mother! I cant even see my own baby!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh sure, come here!  Sure you can! Uh, look come here look,  its-its-its, its right there .

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh. Oh, its beautiful. I see it now.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Do you really?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, I dont see it!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Come on! Come on! Here, okay-okay, you see this?  This tiny thing that looks like a peanut?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Sweetie thats it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thats it? Well I saw that! Ohh-ohh-oh, thank you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Youre welcome.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wow! I cant believe thats our baby.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, thats our baby.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey! So how was the doctor?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, everything went great.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh hey, show them the picture of your uterus.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I dont see the baby. Where is it?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh no, I know I couldnt see it either at first, but its right umm  Ross, I lost it again.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh. (He takes the picture and hugs her.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Wait. Before we go in, I just want you to know I love you. I had a great time on our honeymoon, and I cant wait to go in there and spend the rest of our life together.

lines.text: Youre really sticking with the shell necklace huh?

lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! Youre back!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi sweetie!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Come on in!

lines.text: So how was the honeymoon?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, so much fun. But the best part is, we met this incredible couple on the way back.

lines.text: That was the best part?  Good honeymooning tiger.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No, they were really cool. They were on their honeymoon too!

lines.speaker: chandler

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right, all right! Lets just cut to the chase, okay?  Youre single.  Youre single.  He gets off work at eleven.  Shell be waiting for your call.  Ill give him your number if I can get one calamari and one Caesar salad!!  I did not yell. I am not putting a dollar in the jar.

lines.speaker: mr. franklin
lines.text: Wow Bing! Burning the midnight oil.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You know me sir. Oh ah, I do have a question for ya. Do you know how I get around the office computer network so I can access the really good Internet porn?

lines.speaker: mr. franklin
lines.text: Youre a joker Bing.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Whats funny about that?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey! Sorry I kept you waiting so long.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey thats okay. So, where do you want to go?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh ah, I think you know where I want to go.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: The Hard Rock Caf�?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Again?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah!!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Im telling you, I like the food!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You like the Purple Rain display!  Hey Bob.

lines.speaker: bob
lines.text: Hey Toby! Have a good night.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Did that guy just call you Toby?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, he thinks thats my name.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, why dont you correct him?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh its been going on way to long now. Yknow, I mean the first time he said it we were just passing each other in the hallway, so I didnt say anything. And then the next time he said, "Hey Toby, do you want a donut?" And I-I wanted a donut. And now its five years later, the donuts gone and Im still Toby.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Five years?! Chandler you have to tell him!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No! That would be so awkward! LookBesides, we work in different departments. Hes on the sixth floor yknow? So he calls me Toby once in a while. Whats the big deal? It could be worse, its not like hes calling me Muriel.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Muriel. Wh-why would he call you Muriel?  Oh my God! Chandler M Bing? Its not just an M, your middle name is Muriel!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Shh! It is a family name!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Chandler Muriel Bing. Boy, your parents never gave you a chance did they?

lines.speaker: joey's co-star
lines.text: Drake, Ive discovered the reason for all your headaches and memory loss.

lines.speaker: dr. drake ramoray
lines.text: What is it?

lines.speaker: joey's co-star
lines.text: Apparently your brain transplant was not entirely successful. It seems your body is rejecting Jessicas brain.

lines.speaker: dr. drake ramoray
lines.text: Is it serious?

lines.speaker: joey's co-star
lines.text: Not if we extract tissue from the original host body, synthesize antibodies, and introduce them into your system, which could stop it from rejecting the brain.

lines.speaker: dr. drake ramoray
lines.text: Well that sounds simple enough, lets just do that.

lines.speaker: joey's co-star
lines.text: We would, but when we went to exhume Jessicas body, it was gone.

lines.speaker: director
lines.text: Cut! Very nice people!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, let me just get changed and we can go to dinner.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well dontWhat happened to Jessicas body?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Im not telling, youll have to see it on TV!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You dont know do you?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, couldnt care less.

lines.speaker: joey's co-star
lines.text: Hey good scene man.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey you too!

lines.speaker: joey's co-star
lines.text: Alright.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What? You werent in it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh sorry. Uh-uh, Kash?

lines.speaker: kash
lines.text: Yes?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: This is my friend Rachel. Rachel, Kash, Kash, Rachel.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: kash
lines.text: Hey! How come I havent seen you here before?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, Joey probably thinks Ill just embarrass him. Yknow, he thinks Im some kind of a soap opera nutWhich Im not! Im not. Although I do know that your uh, your favorite ice cream flavor is butter pecan.  And uh, and that your-your dogs name is Wally. Well look at that, Im just stroking your arm.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Here we go! Here we go!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, were leaving. Bye Kash.

lines.speaker: kash
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Say hi to Wally.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ooh Monica!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh my God! I had the best time with Tim last night. He is so sweet! Oh, I cant wait to get sous-neath him.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I I have to fire him.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: But why?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Because hes terrible! Okay, hes slow, he burns things, last night he lit my pastry chef on fire!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well maybe he was just nervous, yknow you can be very intimidating. And besides Ive met your pastry chef and she can stand to be taken down a peg or two.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, now she has no eyebrows, mission accomplished.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: But Monica, he loves his job so much! Can you just give him another chance? Please?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right, but if-if he lights someone else on fire he is out of there!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Thats fair! Thank you so much. Thanks. Oops, it looks like when he got the pastry chef he got you a little bit too.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I paid to have this done.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Love it!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh you know uh Kash, really liked you the other day. He said he thought you were charming.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I thought I was a complete idiot.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, Im with you. He even asked me if I thought youd go out with him.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh! Oh, I think Im gonna throw up a little bit. What did you say?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I said no.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What? I I just figured since youre pregnant youre not gonna be seeing people.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay Joey, first of all Kash Ford is not people. Second of all, what did he say when you told him I was pregnant?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I didnt tell him. I didnt know if you were telling people. This is back when I thought Kash was still people.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Good-good, dont tell him. Dont tell him. Just have him call me okay?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Rach look, I really dont think thats such a great

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, you go do it! Ill come back to that set! Ill meet more actors! Ill meet em all!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey Bob.

lines.speaker: bob
lines.text: Hey! Hows my pal Toby doing today?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: If I see him, Ill ask.

lines.speaker: bob
lines.text: Toby!

lines.speaker: mr. franklin
lines.text: Hey-hey! Bing? Was that Bob from six you were just talking too?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: mr. franklin
lines.text: Oh then you know each other.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Were on a semi-first name basis.

lines.speaker: mr. franklin
lines.text: What do you think of adding him to our team?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Bob? Ooh, working here with us? Everyday? Yeah, I dont know if he has what it takes.

lines.speaker: mr. franklin
lines.text: Really? They love him down on six.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: But this is eleven. Its almost twice as hard up here.

lines.speaker: mr. franklin
lines.text: Okay, I hear you loud and clear. Bob will stay put.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I think its best sir.

lines.speaker: mr. franklin
lines.text: But we really do need to find someone up here. The work is starting to pile up. Ive got a stack of documents on my desk this high.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow what you should do, just toss em in the shedder and claim you never got em.

lines.speaker: mr. franklin
lines.text: Thats a good one.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What does a guy have to do to be taken seriously around here?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey. Okay, I gave him another chance, but Tim has got to go!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: But

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No! No-no! He is totally incompetent. I called the chef who recommended him to me. He said, "Ha-ha! Gotcha!"

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay. Okay, but you cant fire him today.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Why not?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Because Im dumping him today.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?! You said he was sweet!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: He is sweet. Hes too sweet. He calls me all the time.  "So did-did you get home from work okay?" "Did-did you get out of the shower okay?"

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Just dont pick up your phone.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Then he comes over!  "Im so worried about you." Uck! Be a man!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What? So now Im not allowed to fire him?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You cant fire him and dump him the same day, hell kill himself.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay well then, Ill fire him today and you go out with him for another week.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Are you kidding?! Another week with that sip, Ill kill myself!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay well, then well both do it today and hell just have to deal with it!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay. But the question is whos gonna go first. Cause whoever goes second is the bitch.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Come on! The boss that fires a guy thats just been dumped, bitch! And the woman who dumps a guy thats just been fired, blond bitch!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I wanted to do this days ago so I think I should go first.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: All right, that makes sense.  Ugh. ButScrew you Im going first!

lines.speaker: bob
lines.text: Hey Toby, you got a sec?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Sure, whats up?

lines.speaker: bob
lines.text: I just had a meeting, I was actually hoping to get transferred up here, but I just found out its not gonna happen. Apparently somebody thinks Im not eleventh floor material. Say uh, who the hell is this Chandler?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey, what do you think is a better excuse for why Im not drinking on this date tonight. "Umm, Im a recovering alcoholic. Im a Mormon," or "I got so hammered last night Im still a little drunk?"

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So, what do you want to do tonight? Theres a Ukrainian film at the Angelica thats supposed to be very powerful. Interested?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No. No. But Ill go see a normal person movie with ya.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Rach? You wanna come?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh no, I cant. I got a date.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: A date?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah. Why? Is that weird for you?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Why no, its the opposite of weird. Its-its uh, regular. Its-its uh, its mundane. Its actually uh, a little dull.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Its no Ukrainian film.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: YeahOoh! Earrings!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: A date?! Shes-shes got a date?! With who?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I set her up with this actor on my show.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You set her up?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Joey what-what were you thinking?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, I was thinking that itd probably be okay because Ross hasnt gone out with Rachel in five years!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Joey, Im not worried about her! Im worried about my baby! Whoever she dates my baby dates! Now-now where is this  actor taking them?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! Im an  actor too! Im not sure. I think theyre taking the ferry out to some Italian place on Staten Island.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: A ferry? My baby is going on a ferry? Do you have any idea how dangerous those are?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Are we talking about one of those big boats that carry cars that go like five miles an hour?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Why dont they just jump out of an airplane?! Huh?! That-thats a fun date! Or burn each other with matches?! Thats fun too! Whew!!

lines.speaker: kash
lines.text: Hey Joey.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey Kash. Uh hey-hey this is Ross. Ross, this is Kash.

lines.speaker: kash
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hi. I-I hear youre going on a ferry tonight.

lines.speaker: kash
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: A bit of a daredevil are we?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey guys do you think this is too sluttyHi Kash!

lines.speaker: kash
lines.text: Hey Rachel! You ready to go?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah! All right, Ill see you guys later.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay. Have a great time you guys.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: kash
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yes it is too slutty!

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Oh, Im so glad you called. I feel like its always me calling you. So, whats up? Is everything okay with Phoebe?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: It will be in a minute. Listen, Tim youre a really great guy.

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Its because Im with you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Aw.  Im justIm in a place in my life right now where I I

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Whoops. Sorry.  This just in.  Oh, its 9-1-1 from the restaurant, that means Monica needs me right away.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh-oh no she doesnt! I know what that is. You can stay.

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Awww, Ill miss you too Pheebs.  And I will be holding you, right here.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So what movie do you want to seeAnd not another one I have to read. Okay? I get enough of that from books.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Books?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right, car magazines, cereal boxes, but its like enough!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, I tell you what. Why dont we uh, why dont we just stay here? Lets not see a movie, well just hang.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And just wait for Rachel to come back from her date?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, if thats what you want to do Im not gonna say no.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Dude! What is going on?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I just I have to find out how it went.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: This guy could be my babys stepfather!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: They go on one date and youre worried about them getting married?! Hes not you!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I justI-I cant believe shes-shes dating?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well Ross, what did you think she was gonna do?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I dont know! I guess I just cant believe any of this is happening.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Its just I always thought when I had another kid it would be different. Now I-I love Ben, but every time I have to drop him off at Carol and Susans, its likeIt breaks my heart a little. I mean Ive always had this picture of me and my next wife in bed on Sunday and, my kid comes running in and leaps up onto the bed. And we all read the paper together. Yknow? Maybe fight over the science section.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thats a nice picture. Maybe you can still have that!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No! No I cant. I mean Rachels out with some guy. My baby went with her. If anything that picture keeps moving further away.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, can I ask you something? In this, in this picture of you and your wife, is your wife Rachel?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: It used to be. Now she doesnt really have a face. Smokin body though.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Good call. Yeah. But, the face Ross, the face isnt Rachel.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No but ahh! How much easier would it be if it were?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I know, but I dont think thats what she wants.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, its not what I want either. I mean I-I cant force myself to fall in love with her again now.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thats okay Ross maybe you need a new picture. Okay? Its not gonna be what you thought, but no matter what theres gonna be a brand new little baby, your baby. Who cares what the picture looks like?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, I tell you what. Lets you and me go out and have some fun. Huh? Whatever you want. Come on!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: We can still catch that Ukrainian film.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, I said fun!

lines.speaker: bob
lines.text: Hey Toby!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey Bobby.

lines.speaker: bob
lines.text: Its Bob actually. Hey, you work up here, can you tell me where this Chandler Bings office is?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Uhh yeah. Yeah, its  right, right down there.  Right there, yeah. Can I ask you why?

lines.speaker: bob
lines.text: I want to talk to that bastard, see what his problem is.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay Bob listen uhh, Im the reason you didnt get the job up here.

lines.speaker: bob
lines.text: Toby dont.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Bob!

lines.speaker: bob
lines.text: Toby! Im not gonna let you cover for him. Anything you say right now will just get me more upset with Chandler!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well that puts me in a difficult position.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: I got your page, is everything okay?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Uh well that depends, how are things with Phoebe?

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Oh its great! Its great! Thank you so much for introducing us!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my pleasure. Okay, Im afraid Ive got some bad news.  Phoebe!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Monica!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Youre fired!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Im breaking up with you!

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Im, Im breaking up with you.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Youre fired.

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Im sorry, Im justIm Im just not ready for a relationship right now.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah and-and Im sorry too. But, well I justI like things done a certain way and the chemistrys just not right.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh thats good, the chemistry thing for us too.

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Wow! Umm, okay. Umm  I-I-I realize I came on a little strong but, its only because I think youre so amazing.  And uh, I-I just wanna, I just wanna tell you how much I appreciate you giving me an opportunity here because Iyoure the most talented chef Ive ever worked for. Anyway

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Tim wait!

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Umm, I think I spoke too quickly. There-theres a learning curve with this job and maybe we can try it again.

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Thank you so much! Cause I-I know I can do better!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: And Tim I just wanna say, good luck here.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hello.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, how was the date?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well Im alone and I just bought fifteen dollars worth of candy bars, what do you think?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh-huh. What happened?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I made the mistake of telling him that I was pregnant.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ah, he didnt uh, take it so well?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well better than you, but yknow still not what you want.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: He got all weird and sputtery and then he said uh, "Yeah, I hear those hemorrhoids are a bitch."

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: He sounds swell.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Doesnt he?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, wanna wanna a little cheering up?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Sit down.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Guess whose middle name is Muriel.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler M. Bing?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah-ha!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Im sorry about your date.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh its all right. Im guess Im just done with the whole dating thing. Its one more thing in my life thats suddenly completely different. This is hard.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah I know.  On the other hand in um, in about seven months youre gonna have something that youre gonna love more than any guy youve ever gone out with. Just wait. Wait until uh, wait until the first time your baby grabs your finger. You have no idea.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thanks sweetie.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You wanna, you wanna grab some coffee?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh no, I think Im gonna go home and eat ten candy bars.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, I thought I cheered you up.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh you did, there are twenty in here.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Right. Good night.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Good night.

lines.speaker: mona
lines.text: Ross?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: mona
lines.text: Hey its Mona! From the wedding.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh hi!

lines.speaker: mona
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wow! Uh how are you?

lines.speaker: mona

lines.text: Wanna go see a movie?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yes!  Bye daddy.

lines.speaker: dr. green
lines.text: theres gonna be a wedding!  Thats unacceptable Rachel! What the hell does love have to do with it anyway?! There are more important things in a marriage other than love!   constantly thinking about things! You have to think about the consequences of your decision.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! I do too think about the consequences of my decisions!  What gives you the right to  Go to hell!  Stupid guy on my phone.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey Rach listen, did you know that during pregnancy your fingers swell up to twice their size and never go back.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God! Let me see that!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You fall for it every time!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I brought you my old maternity clothes!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh Pheebs thats so sweetOoh, those are so cute!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah! And look,  see how they expand as the baby grows?  And then after the babys born, theyre great for shoplifting melons.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh good youre all here. Thanksgiving tomorrow, four oclock.  Oh, guess who I invited. Remember that guy Will Colbert from high school?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: He was in Rosss class marching band kinda overweight? Well, really overweight. I mean I was his thin friend.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wow! I dont remember him. Honey, are you sure youre not talking about your imaginary boyfriend.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No that was Jarred! Wow! I havent thought about him in a long time   Anyway, umm Wills, Wills here on business and he didnt have a place to go so I invited him here.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh thats nice.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, and by the way, hes lost a bunch of weight. I mean he looks goo- ood! Okay, I mean really, really gorgeous!  I still love Chandler.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I just want you to say it once in a while.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right okay, just so you know, Im not gonna make a turkey this year.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well Phoebe doesnt eat turkey

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Phoebe!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Turkeys are beautiful, intelligent animals!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No theyre not! Theyre ugly and stupid and delicious!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right! Okay, its just Phoebe. Wills still on a diet, Chandler doesnt eat Thanksgiving food, and Rachels having her aversion to poultry.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: She is?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Remember I had to leave the room the other day when you had that roast chicken?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah. But I thought that was because I put the whole thing on my hand and made it walk across the table.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Anyway, it just doesnt seem worth it to make a whole turkey for just three people. Okay? Its a lot of work.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: But you gotta have turkey on Thanksgiving! I mean, Thanksgiving with no turkey is like-like Fourth of July with no apple pie! Or Friday with no two pizzas!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right fine! If it means that much to you! But justtheres gonna be a ton left over.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No there wont! I promise I will finish that turkey!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right, youre telling me you can eat an entire turkey in just one sitting?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thats right! Cause Im a Tribbiani!  And this is what we do! I mean we may not be great thinkers or world leaders, we dont read a lot or run very fast, but damnit! We can eat!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, isnt weird to think about how next year at this time theyll be a little baby at the table?   Rachels! But good to know where youre at!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Happy Thanksgiving!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You too!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Anything I can do to help?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Actually there is. Chandler usually helps me with this, but hes really into the game so I dont want to bother him. Could you help me fold these napkins?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Sure!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Im gonna go across the hall to check on the yams.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No! No! No! No sweetie! No! Not like that! Were not at a barn dance. Youve gottayou wanna fold them like swans. Like I showed you at Christmas time, remember?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, it all just came screaming back to me.   So hows the game?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I have no idea.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah! Im just pretending to watch the game so I dont have to help out with stuff.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I dont believe you! That is brilliant! And Monica has no idea?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Nope! Every once and a while I just scream stuff at the TV.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Is your team winning hon?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah! Anderson just scored again!  Theres no Anderson.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well I want to get in on this. Hey Mon? I dont think I can help you after all, I didnt realize this game was on.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, I didnt know you liked football.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well normally I dont, but yknow  Green Bay is playing.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You like Green Bay?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well its only like my favorite bay! {Actually, its not bad. It just gets a little cold in winter, but in Wisconsin winter only lasts from August to June. J }

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Happy Thanksgiving!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Aww thanks! God Will Im so glad that you came! You look great! You mustve lost like

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: 150 pounds. Yeah, Im gonna be in one of those Subway sandwich commercials.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: A pie!

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Oh right. All right, its no fat, its no sugar, its no dairy its no good. Throw it out.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You wanna meet some people? This is uh; this is my husband Chandler. Chandler, this is Will.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh hey. Id shake your hand but uh; Im really into the game. Plus, I think itd be better for my ego if we didnt stand right next to each other.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is Phoebe.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey.  Wow!  Well done.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wanna give me a hand?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Sure! Monica, I cant get over how great you look! You look stunning!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well you look incredible too! Youre justyoure so fit!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im watching the game, but Im not deaf!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh umm, I meant to tell you, Ross is coming.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Ross is coming. Great! I love Ross!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Good. And Rachel Green too.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Is there a problem?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Nope. Uh, its okay. Its just uh, God I hated her.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Yeah, I hated her. She was horrible to me in high school. But hey, it was a long time ago, Im in a good place, it might be actually fun to see her again. You got any cakes or cookies or something?  No Will no!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow, its been a while since weve screamed something. Maybe we should.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh okay.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh come on!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Noooo!! Damn you ref! You burn in hell!!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, what are you doing? You gotta save room, youve got almost an entire turkey to eat.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Let me explain to you how the human body works. I have to warm my stomach first. Eatin chips is like stretching.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Dont worry, Tribbianis never get full.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: I actually know what youre talking about. Im here to tell you something my friend, you can eat and eat and eat but nothing will ever fill that void.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Who the hell is this guy?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Will! From high school.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh hey!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Joey.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Hello.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Will!

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Ross!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey-hey you came! Man you look incredible! Hot stuff!  Hot stuff?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Its good to see you man.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, you too. Man, so-so what are you up to?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Im a commodities broker.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Really? Yeah that-that sounds interesting.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Yeah, its not. But Im rich and thin.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh! Man I dont think Ive seen you since uh, Lance Davis graduation party.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: That was such a fun night!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah. It wouldve been good if we had gotten in, but still real fun.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: God we were lame back then. Do you remember how into dinosaurs we were?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: So what do you, what do you do now?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So how long are you in town?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey sweetie. Oh good.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Rachel Green.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Awoh, thats right. Are-are you gonna be okay?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Oh, Ill-Ill be fine. Just God I hate her Ross! I hate her!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Will, high school was-was a long time ago.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Look at her standing there with those yams! My two greatest enemies Ross: Rachel Green and complex carbohydrates.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God Monica, who is that?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats Will from high school!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh! I do not remember him! Wow! He's really got that sexy, smoldering thing going on.  Oh my God, hes Look at the way hes just staring at me. I think hes trying to mouth something to me, but I cant make it out.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, dinners ready!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Good game!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah. Solid effort. Solid effort.

lines.text: Oh, so who won?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Green Bay.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Detroit.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?
