lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi! Will, right?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi! Im Rachel Green.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Oh I-I remember you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Really?! Arent you sweet! I gotta tell you though, I am, I am having the hardest time placing you. Oh-oh hang on! Did we umm, did we fool around at Lance Davis graduation party?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: You are unbelievable.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Uh Rachel? Rachel, why dont you sit here?  And Will you sit way over there.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thats it?! Even if nobody helps me I can eat that no problem. At least give me a challenge!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is Chandlers chicken. This is the turkey.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh. How-how big is that?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: About nineteen pounds.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Its like me when I was born.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right, who would uh, like some yams? Will?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Oh, youd like that wouldnt ya?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?  Oh yknow what? Can we please keep the chicken and the turkey and everything on the other side of the table? The smell is just yuck!

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Typical.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im sorry. What?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: I said it was typical. Typical of you, Rachel Green, Queen Rachel does whatever she wants in little Rachel land.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Seriously, who is this guy?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Umm, Im sorry. Do you-do you have a problem with me?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: I dont know? Do I? Do I?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I think you do.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Apparently you were umm, a little mean to him in high school.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: A little mean? You made my life miserable!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im-ImI had no idea. Im sorry. I

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Well you should be. Screw it! Bring on the yams!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh Will. But you-youve worked so hard

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Yams!!!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Uh Will umm, I just want to say that Im real sorry for whatever I-I did to you in high school

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Oh, it wasnt just me. We had a club!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You had a club?!

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Thats right, The I Hate Rachel Green Club!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Whoa! My God! So what, you all just joined together to hate me?! Who else was in this club?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Me and Ross.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No need to point, she knows who Ross is.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So you were in an I Hate Rachel club?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Yes he was.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No. No.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So who else was in this club?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh actually, there-there was also that exchange student from Thailand but I-I dont think he-he knew what it was.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So Ross, we went out for two years, and you never told me you were in an I Hate Rachel club.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: You went out with her?! We had a pact!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: That was in high school! Its not like it was binding forever.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Then why did it have the word eternity in it?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay Monica, did you know about this?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I swear I didnt.  Hey! Is that why you guys used to go up to your bedroom and lock the door?

lines.speaker: ross and will
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hmm, a little relieved, I gotta say.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look Rach I-Im sorry, okay? I I was a stupid kid, okay? The only reason I joined

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Co-founded!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: co-founded. Co-founded the club was because I was insanely in love with you. Obviously I didnt handle it very well. But if you think about it the I Hate Rachel Club was really the I Love Rachel Club.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Uh, except that it was really the I Hate Rachel Club.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay. So what? You guys would just like get together and like just say mean things about me?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Well, we did a little more than that.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No-no! No-no. No-no.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?! What else did you do?

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: We started a rumor.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What rumor?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, come on Will! Just take off your shirt and tell us!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ross!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: It was no big deal. We-we said that the rumor was that umm you had both male and female reproductive parts.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Thats right! We said your parents flipped a coin, decided to raise you as a girl, but you still had a hint of a penis.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You started that?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?! You heard that?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Everyone at our school heard it!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Everybody at my school heard it! You were the hermaphrodite cheerleader from Long Island?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh no!!!! Oh my God!! This is all making so much sense to me now! This is why Adam Carter wouldnt go out with me! This is why Billy Tratt would just stay in this region!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Actually, Billy Tratt is gay now. So-so that ones not really our fault.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Monica, how come you never told me this?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I thought it might be true. And I was afraid that you were gonna cry and then show it to me.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey stop staring! Theres nothing there! Its not true!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Im afraid Im gonna need proof.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You are my Everest.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Joey, you dont have to finish that.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh yes I do. Otherwise whats next? Today Im just a guy who cant finish a turkey, but tomorrow Im the guy who eats half a Powerbar, wraps up the rest, and puts in the fridge? No! No, I just I justI gotta change my pants.  Jeans have no give.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay! Okay! Listen to what Sean McMahon wrote in my yearbook senior year, "Dear Rach, youre such a good person." Not girl! Person!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Rach, I think youre reading a little too much into it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: "Dear Rach, youre a great person. Sorry about your tiney-wienie."

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look, what do you want me to do? Do you want me to call everyone in the entire school and tell them it wasnt true?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yes!

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Could you also tell them Im skinny now?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh! Me too!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well look-look Im not calling anybody! Okay? It was like a million years ago!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I dont care how long ago it was! You told people that I was half and half! Yknow what? I just want to point out I never did anything to hurt you in high school.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats not totally true.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well you-you did start that rumor about Ross making out with Mrs. Altman, our 50-year-old librarian.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: How did you know that?!!!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Its true?!!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yes it is! I saw you guys going at it behind the card catalog!

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Mrs. Altman? She also made out with Takaka Ci-Kek the night before he went back to Thailand.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im sorry. When you were in high school you made out with a 50-year- old woman?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey! She didnt look 50!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Did she look 16?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ohh, theres a picture of her in the yearbook actually.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh!  Wow!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: She didnt photograph well!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, she probably wasnt familiar with the process having spent most of her life sitting for oil paintings!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So how did this happen? Did she, did she lure you to an early bird dinner?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I was working late in the library one afternoon. It was just the two of us. She needed some help with her word jumble. And one thing led to another. If you must know, Anita was very gentle and tender. May she rest in peace

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Didnt she walk with a cane?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Only when it was damp!!  I cant believe you-you told people about this?! Everybody knew?! Yknow what?  Im back in the club!

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I wanna join!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: WhPhoebe!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Im sorry. Im sorry. I never got to be in a club. I-I didnt go to high school, but three of us would meet behind a dumpster to learn French. Bonjour.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right, yknowFine! You guys have your stupid little club, but I would just like to say is what you did to me is way worse than what I did to you! You gave me a tiney-wienie!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right, listen youre just being silly. Rachel, even with that rumor you were one of the most popular girls in school and everyone wanted to be like you. One girl wanted to be like you so much she stuffed her pants with a Tootsie Roll!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wow

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: And Ross, if it werent for Rachels rumor I mean no one in high school would even know who you were. She put you on the map!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: As a romancer of the elderly.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey! Mrs. Altman was the kind of woman you could tell she used to be pretty.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: The eyes did still sparkle.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey guys this stuff is just so way in the past. You-youve been through so much since then. And right now youve got so much more important stuff going on in your life. Cant you just let this go?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Shes right.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah. I mean we are having a baby together.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Hold on! You got her pregnant?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: Are ya getting married?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Nope.

lines.speaker: will
lines.text: So you knocked her up but youre not gonna marry her. Dude!  Anybody?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay.  Its exactly how Id imagined it would be.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right wheres that turkey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Joey! Those are my maternity pants!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Not now! These are my Thanksgiving pants!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well thats it. Im done. Whew!  There come the meat sweats.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well Joey, were all were all very proud of you.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes, I believe we can expect a call from the President any moment now.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Is there anything we can do for you?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No just, nobody press on my stomach.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You can keep those pants by the way.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Whoaheywh-wh-what do you got there? What is that? Pie?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, you want some?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ah, just cut me a little sliver.  A little bigger.  Little bigger.  What?! Are you afraid youre gonna run out?! Cut me a real piece!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey! So what do you think?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: New haircut?  Necklace?  Dress?  Boots?  Boots!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yes! Now, theyre a little more than I normally spend on boots or rent

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im gonna miss being able to afford food.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Im sorry, they just, they just look so good! And the saleswoman was looking at me like, "Oh, these are way too expensive for you."

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: She had a point.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God!  Oh Monica! Those boots are amazing!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Theyre mine!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah well, too bad were gonna have to return them.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Return them?! Shh! Theyre gonna hear you!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Honey, Im not returning them. Okay? I mean I-I know they cost a lot, but Im going to wear them all the time. Youll see. Besides, I love the compliments. I mean, have you ever had something so beautiful everyone wanted it?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I have you.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Nice try; Im keeping the boots.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thats right, I love you! And-and Im gonna play with you all the time.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: How can you let him talk to your crotch like that?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hes talking to the baby.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ohh! Okay! Okay, cause when-when he said, "I cant wait to hear your first words," I thought, "Theres a trick."

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay. Well, I gotta go you guys. Ill see you later.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh hey Rach, listenHi!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Umm, can you do me a favor? I was talkin to my sister and she knows you work at Ralph Lauren

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, forget it! No way! I am not sending anymore Ralph Lauren clothes to prison. It is a waste.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No-no-no-no-no-no, not her, not her. My youngest sister, Dina, shes really interested in fashion, and she wants to talk to someone successful, yknow, to give her some advice.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I guess I can talk to one of my supervisors

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh no-no-no-no, she wants to talk to you!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Really?! Oh my God! Im successful!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, so will you meet with her?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yes! Id love to! Have her come by the office.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Great! Thanks! Youre gonna love her so much. AndOh, shes the smartest of all the Tribbiani children. Hey, yknow the S.A.Ts?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: She took em!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey Ross! Doesnt Ben go to the Smithfield Day School?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah. Why?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Sting has a son that goes there too!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah I know; hes in Bens class.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You knew this and you never said anything?! With all the stupid dinosaur stuff you tell us?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Fine! No more dinosaur stuff! Can I talk about fossils?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Stings son, seven years old and theres a picture.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What are you reading? The Kidnappers Guide to Manhattan Private Schools?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No, its New York magazine. Its an article about the best schools in the city. So how well do you know Sting?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh, I actually havent even met him.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh, yeah thats too bad. I really want to go to his concert Friday night, but its totally sold out. I know! Why dont you meet him and get tickets?! If you get two Ill take you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well actually, Im picking Ben up tomorrow, maybe hell be there.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: There you go! Oh, you are so lucky! You might actually get to meet Sting tomorrow! Thats why you have kids!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey guys!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey-hey.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi Monica!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi boots.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: See Chandler? Im getting a lot of use out of them already! Theyre very practical. See, you can wear them with dresses, with skirts, with pants

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You can wear them with shorts on a street corner and earn the money to pay for them.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wow! Theyre beautiful!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ahh

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: They hurt so much!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: The guy who made these hates feet and wants to see them die!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well-well you can give them to me! I havent felt my feet in years!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I cant! I spent so much money on them and I told Chandler that Id wear them all the time, I just cant give them away!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well then get your money back and return them!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I cant do that either! The soles are already a little scuffed up and the insides are filled with my blood.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey I uh just picked up Ben from school

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I dont think you did a very thorough job!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I dropped him off at Carols.  Anyway, it turns out that Im not going to be able to get those tickets though.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh no! Why not?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well it turns out that Ben and Stings son do not get along.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: How come?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Apparently, Stings son made fun of the fact that Bens moms are lesbinims.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wait! But Ross if they dont get along then you should smooth things over. Make them be friends.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Phoebe, you cant force kids to be friends.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Sure you can! Give them some blocks, put them in a playpen!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Playpen?! Bens seven!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Your kid is seven?!   Hes really small.  Please! Please get the tickets!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look Im sorry Pheebs, I cant do it.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes you can! Sting says so himself!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Rosssss can!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look Phoebe, Im sorry its just

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Rossss can!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Phoebe, I

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Rosss can! Give me the tickets! Ross can give me the tickets!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Here she is! Future fashion superstar!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh Joey, Im hardly a

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: My little sister Dina!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Right! Hi Dina!

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Nice to meet you.

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Thanks so much for meetin with me. Joeys told me so much about you!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: This is so exciting for her. Well, Ill let you two fash ists get down to business.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay. All right Dina, well lets talk about the different areas of fashion that you could get involved in. Lets see, theres design, but you may need a whole other degree for that. Uh, theres-theres sales, which is great because you get to travel

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: I I dont care about fashion! Im pregnant! And I know you are too, so you gotta help me!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And theres marketing

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ahhhhhhhh!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Whats wrong?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh nothing Im justjust was yawning.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh dont forget, my office holiday party is tonight.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Honey, we dont really have to go to this thing tonight do we?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Now sweetie, I know you dont like my office parties, but you can wear your new boots. See? Every cloud has a supple leather lining.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I-I dont-I dont think that Im gonna wear the boots tonight.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well yknow, Im just-Im just worried that bosses will see them and think they pay you too much money. Or! Or your assistant will see them and-and want a raise!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Do you think I work at some kind of boot pricing company?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Anyway, I picked up this outfit that I want to wear and the, and the boots dont really go with it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You said that you paid all that money because those boots go with skirts, dresses, and pants!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Fine! If you want me to wear the boots, Ill wear the boots. In fact, Ill go into my room right now and yknow try the outfit on.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay?  Ooo wee! Christmas party in my boots!

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: I-I cant go in there. I cant tell him!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Honey, its going to be okay. Hes been incredibly supportive of me, and if he gets a little upset; thats what the meatball sub is for.

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! Its my fashion girls!  Whats wrong?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Honey, why dont you sit down? Dina has something that she wants to tell you.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh. Whats, whats going on? Is it mom? Is she sick? Is it dads heart? Is that a sandwich?

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Joe, mom and dad are fine

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Is that a sandwich?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey theres something that you should know. Dina?

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Im pregnant.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Now! Give him the sandwich! Give him the sandwich!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well obviously this is a mistake! You cant be pregnant! Because you have to have sex to get pregnant!

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Joe, I tried to wait until I was 25 like you did!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?! Dina

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Bub!!!   I cant believe this! Youre the good one! You went to college! Both years! Who did this to you?!

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Bobby Corso, but hes a real nice guy. I like him a lot. Hes real funny.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You got pregnant for funny?! Dina if hes funny laugh! All right, Ill be back in a little while! You stay here!

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Why? Where are you going?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I cant look at you right now!

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Wow.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I know.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, there you are Ben!

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Aunt Phoebe, what are you doing here?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, I heard youre having a problem with one of the boys in your class. And so I thought I would just come down here and sit you both down, have a little talk and make it all okay. Now umm, the boys name is Stings son.

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Jack? I hate him! Hes a jerk.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Now Ben, sometimes people may seem like jerks on the outside, but they have famous fathers.

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: I have to go. My friend Doug is waiting for me over there.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Him youre friends with.

lines.speaker: the teacher
lines.text: Excuse me. Can, can I help you with something?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes! Yes you can, Im looking for Jacks parents.

lines.speaker: the teacher
lines.text: Are you with one of the students?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh, Im with Ben.

lines.speaker: the teacher
lines.text: Are you one of Bens mothers?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I am one of Bens mothers. Im a lesbian. It was, it was difficult coming out to my parents.

lines.speaker: the teacher
lines.text: Well hi, Im Jenny Boone. Im the new teacher here.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: the teacher
lines.text: Ive only met your partner Carol.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ah! Okay so that would make me Susan.

lines.speaker: the teacher
lines.text: Right. Are you looking for Jacks parents to discuss the problems hes having with Ben?  Yeah. Because I really do think the parents should sit down and have a conversation.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah! Lets do that!! That-that sounds good. We should sit down and talk, just me, my lover Carol, and the Stings. Umm, how-how will I get in touch with them?

lines.speaker: the teacher
lines.text: Oh, their number is on the contact sheet.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Umm, could-could I get a copy of that? Cause Carol threw it out, she lost ours. Shes such a scatterbrain, but man what a hot piece of ass.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow, that party wasnt bad.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah! I didnt know there would be dancing. That was a fun surprise!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I dont see any uh, cabs. Maybe we should just walk?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh no, we cant walk!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What honey, its like fifteen blocks to the subway. Lets go.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey! Do you think that we can get to the subway right there if we climb down through the manhole cover?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Whats going on?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I cant walk. Okay? Okay? These boots were a huge mistake!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay you were right! All right, I never should have bought them! Theyre killing me! One toe at a time!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So I was right. This is what it feels like to be right.  Its oddly unsettling.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: How are we gonna get home? Maybe a piggy-back ride?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hop on.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay. Wait, just give me a second, I need to just get my boots off first.  Ah Ooh Oohh Ohh Oh God Ohh Oh Ohh Ohhhh

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Honey, I know youre in pain right now, but Im a little turned on.

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Do you ever worry that youll be walking and your baby will just like slip out?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What college was that Dina?

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Oh my God! Bobby!

lines.speaker: bobby
lines.text: Hi Dina. Good to see you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey, what are you doing?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Just what needs to be done! Dearly beloved, we are gathered here to join this man and this woman

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh Joey this is crazy!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Dont interrupt me when Im talkin to God! Now where were we? Oh right, okay. Do you Dina, take this man

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh youll take em!

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: No I wont!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! You dont get a say in this!

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Yes I do!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ahhh! I heard "I do", were halfway there! Okay!  You!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right Joey! That is enough!  Listen, as beautiful and moving as this ceremony is, its not legal. Okay? They-they dont have a marriage license, they dont have any witnesses, and the groom only has on one shoe!

lines.speaker: bobby
lines.text: Yeah, he took the other one off and hit me with it.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well what am I supposed to do?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Youre supposed to realize that they are adults! And that they can make their own decisions.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No they cant! They were stupid enough to get knocked up!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Heyyyyy! Contraceptives are not always effective!  Right?

lines.speaker: bobby
lines.text: Yeah we kinda didnt use any

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, come on kids! A little help here!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wow! This place is incredible!  Stings pen that he gave to Phoebe.  Come on! Secret passageway!

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: Im Trudie.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: You must be Bens mum.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Why else would I be here?

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: Do sit down.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: I gather Jack and Ben havent been getting along lately.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: Im told there are two sides to this story, but all Ive heard is that Bens a bit of a poo-poo head.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Umm, Im sorry. Wont-wont Jacks father be joining us?

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: Oh Im sorry, Jacks father is not available.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-hmm. Okay. Well then, could we reschedule? For say, Friday night perhaps at 8 oclock?

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: Oh no, I know that wouldnt work. My husbands in concert.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Concert. Yeah. That does put us in quite a pickle. Because you see Im very busy before and after the concert, and hes obviously busy during.

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: So, I guess you and I should talk about Jack and Ben right now.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Unless! Unless umm, okay I-I would be willing to go to the concert, umm, all the while thinking about the children of course.

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: Are you here for tickets?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, thank you. Four would be great.

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: Im not giving concert tickets to someone whod use their son like this!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh good! Then youre in luck! Bens not my son!

lines.speaker: trudie styler
lines.text: Look, Ive just pressed a button, triggering a silent alarm. Any minute now, the police will be here!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: The Police? Here? A reunion?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, ten blocks down. Five to go.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh wait! Stop! Stop! Stop!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh Im sorry! Do you need a break?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: My boots in tan! Hey! Can you get a little closer so I can see the price?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I can see it from right here. Itll cost you one husband.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, Im sorry. I think I can walk the rest of the way now. Just-just give me my boots.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I dont have your boots.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well I dont have them either. Where are they?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, why dont you check in one of my saddlebags while I chew on a bale of hay!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay.  God well, we gotta go back and get them!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Honey, are you seriously ever gonna wear the boots again?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, Im never gonna wear them again. I just didnt get a chance to say goodbye.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow what? You can say goodbye to the tan ones.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay.  All right.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Bye bootsWait! Half off?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey, just because theyre not getting married doesnt mean this is going to be a disaster. Maybe they have a plan!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh? Oh! Okay! Okay! Lets hear their plan! Now, whats the future look like for Dina and Bobby?

lines.speaker: bobby
lines.text: Well I really have high hopes for my band.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You were right. He is funny.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey, now wait a minute! I get when you told people at first that you wanted to be an actor they laughed at you! Now come on Bobby, why dont you tell us a little bit about your band?

lines.speaker: bobby
lines.text: Well its just me and my pal Rooster, the bands name is Numb Nuts.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Dina, if youre having a baby you should be married! Even if it is to Bobby!  Dude, thats not a compliment!

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: No Joey! I knew you wouldnt be supportive!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! What are you gonna do? Youre gonna have the baby and-and raise it by yourself without a husband?! You cant be a single mother alone! Youre gonna ruin your life!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh excuse me! Am I ruining my life?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No! No! No! Its different for you. Youre so strong and together. Youre not some dumb kid who doesnt know what shes doing.

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: One pregnant woman at a time, please! I just want you to be okay.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So forcing her to marry Bobby is gonna make that happen?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Maybe!  Well! Well so-so uh, what kind of music does Numb NutsOh forget it! I cant!

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Joey, I am scared to death about this. But I really think I can do it, Im just gonna need some help. And Bobbys gonna be here the whole time.

lines.speaker: bobby
lines.text: You bet I am!  And to answer your earlier question, were straight-up gangster rap.

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Look, Rachels told me how much easier youve made all this on her. Why cant you do that for me?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Because! Cause Cause youre my baby sister!

lines.speaker: dina

lines.text: Joey, I cant stand the thought of having this baby with you mad at me. I want him to have his uncle. Is my baby gonna have his Uncle Joey?

lines.text: Of course hes gonna have his Uncle Joey!

lines.speaker: dina
lines.text: Were gonna be all right. I mean, even if were not married this baby is gonna be so loved. Not just by us.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thats right! By his uncle too!

lines.text: Okay Bobby, why dont we just come over here and let them have a little moment.

lines.text: No! Seriously! Whats wrong with you?!

lines.speaker: ross

lines.text: Okay, now would you say that thats more than 50 yards away from Sting, his wife, or a member of his family?

lines.text: Oh, what is wrong with me lately? I mean its like every guy I seeI mean look here.  Look at that guy for example, I mean normally thats not someone I would-would be attracted to, but right now, with the way Im feeling, all I want to do is rip off his sweatpants and fanny pack.

lines.text: Wait a second! This is about the fourth month of your pregnancy, right?

lines.speaker: phoebe

lines.speaker: rachel

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ah.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, yknow what? I go see my doctor tomorrow, Ill ask her about this. Maybe she can give me a pill or something.

lines.text: Hey!  Hey!

lines.text: Hi!

lines.text: Yknow she has a face Ross!

lines.speaker: mona
lines.text: Okay. Okay, heres a good one of us.

lines.text: Wow! That is a good one! Wow, it looks like a, like a holiday card yknow, with the tree in the middle and the skaters and the snow.

lines.text: Yknow, every year I say Im gonna send out holiday cards and I never do it. Do you wanna, do you wanna send this one out together?

lines.text: Together? Like-like to people?

lines.speaker: mona

lines.text: Okay.

lines.text: No leg-chewing for us sir.

lines.speaker: doug
lines.text: Oh well, give it time. So the divorce, the marriage, weve got a lot to celebrate. How about we all go out to dinner tomorrow night?

lines.text: I cant think of anything were doing.  Why cant I think of anything were doing?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, Ill see you tomorrow!  Just so you know, were not seeing him tomorrow.  I-I cannot spend another evening with that man. Do you remember how he behaved at our wedding?

lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats because he wasnt invited because of the way he behaved at our engagement party.

lines.text: Oh yeah. Boy, urine cuts right through an ice sculpture doesnt it?

lines.text: Hi!

lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: A hundred?! Well, I-I guess Ill take aMona, uh I-Im not sure about the whole uh, card thing.

lines.text: Sending out a holiday card, together, I mean I just dont know if were really quite there yet.

lines.text: Oh yknow, I didnt think of it that way. Youre right. Youre right. So, can I ask you a question?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: mona
lines.text: Where are we?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Huh.

lines.speaker: mona
lines.text: Yknow, like where are we? Where is this relationship going?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hmm

lines.speaker: mona
lines.text: I mean I love spending time with you, yknow I justI hope were moving forward. I mean, we should probably talk about that. Dont you think?

lines.text: Hi!

lines.text: Oh, okay. Hey, can I ask you a question? Was it me, or-or was the guy who took my blood sample really cute? Yknow who Im talking about, bald haircut, hairy fingers

lines.text: Hi Rachel? Im Dr. Schiff.

lines.text: Good God Bing I well I cant say Im altogether surprised, I saw the way she looked at you, and there was no love there. And the way she looked at me, pure lust.

lines.speaker: mona
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I mean, theres no point in spending time with someone if-if its just fun. Its gotta be, its gotta be going somewhere right? So where-where is it going?  Ah! Thats-thats the real question. And-and the answer is is its going somewhere fun. Now I-I know what youre thinking, fun was fine for you like ten years ago yknow, but youre-youre not getting any younger. No I meanNo not you, not you, youyou are getting younger. I meanyou-you look like youre getting younger by the secondWhats your secret?

lines.speaker: mona
lines.text: Im sorry, so umm, so where are we?

lines.speaker: ross

lines.text: Okay

lines.text: Oh no-no-no!

lines.text: Oh yeah-yeah-yeah, yknow I did it and I felt a hell of a lot better and if you whip it just right you might hit a seagull in the head.

lines.text: Okay, and oh Im gonna need a bunch of extra keys. Apparently I give them away for no reason at all.

lines.text: Umm, I-I thought we were moving forward and now youre-youre sending me all these mixed signals. What are you trying to tell me?

lines.text: It was awful. To get out of going to dinner with Doug I told him that you and I split up. So then he took me to all these strip clubs and sleazy bars, and then when I wouldnt give him my wedding ring, he threw a soda can at a bird!

lines.text: Yes. Hi, Id like to order a pizza. Okay, can I ask you a question? Is-is the cute blond guy delivering tonight? Very Ambercrombie & Fitch.  Ill call you back.

lines.text: Oh you really, you really just dont want to hear about it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, its justand this is really embarrassingbut lately with this whole pregnancy thing Im just finding myself how do I put this umm, erotically charged.

lines.text: Is that college talk for horny?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah. So yknow, I have all of these feelings and I dont know what to do about them, because I cant date like a normal person, which is fine because I dont need a relationship, I mean all I really want is one great night. Just sex, yknow? No strings attached, no relationship, just with someone that I feel comfortable with and who knows what hes doing. For just one great night, I mean is that really so hard to find.  So how was your day?

lines.text: Good, I uh, I saw a pretty big pigeon.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Good night.

lines.text: I cant do it!

lines.text: Youre Joey!

lines.text: Youre my friend!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Right back at ya!

lines.text: But plus, it would be wrong and weird and-and-and bad.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And so bad. I dont even know what youre talking about because I didnt ask you to do anything!

lines.text: I know!

lines.text: No!

lines.text: This conversation never happened!

lines.text: Good night!

lines.text: Hi. Listen, Im sorry about that whole thing with Roger. It really wasnt right, and I, and I want to make it up to you, so umm, I brought you something that I think youll really enjoy.  Now, this is just a loan. Okay? Im gonna, Im gonna want him back. So  Im gonna go now.    Im sorry, I thought I could do it and I cant!

lines.text: Oh my goodness! Where did you hide it?

lines.text: Pheebs you didnt have to get us anything for our wedding you already sang

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well what did it do?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, you justyou put a quarter in and yknow pull-pull some handles and win like a candy bar or something.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: A vending machine?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Dont feel bad for me! I won like every time!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey! Oh, Im so glad you guys are here. Ive been dying to tell someone what happened in the Paleontology department today.

lines.text: Do you think he saw us or can we still sneak out?

lines.text: Professor Neuman, the head of the department, so .

lines.speaker: ross

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh! Hey Rach, listen umm

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I got a big date coming up, do you know a good restaurant?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Uh, Pauls Caf�. They got great food and its really romantic.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ooh, great! Thanks!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah! Oh, and then afterwards you can take her to the Four Seasons for drinks. Or you go downtown and listen to some jazz. Or dancingOh! Take her dancing!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ooh, I miss dating. Gettin all dressed up and going to a fancy restaurant. Im not gonna be able to do that for so long, and its so much fun! I mean not that sitting at home worrying about giving birth to a sixteen pound baby is not fun.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, yknow what?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: joey

lines.speaker: rachel

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yes I do! And were gonna go out, were gonna have a good time, and take your mind off of childbirth and c-sections and-and giant baby heads stretching out

lines.text: Okay! Ill go with ya! Ill go! Ill go with ya.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ill be fun.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No. No! Yes! Ahh. Oh, would you look at that Monica? I just knocked off all of your top scores, how sad.

lines.text: Okay, Im next.  Dont! Dont start another game! I said Im next! Phoebe!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No! No-no! I love it! It is a great present! In fact, why dont you go home and wait for the thank you card?

lines.speaker: phoebe

lines.text: Okay. Phoebe thats it. Come on, get outout of the chair. Get out!  Oh come Phoebe!

lines.text: Oh man! This is so great! I actually feel like Im going on a real date! Although, I have a hint of morning sickness, and Im wearing underwear that goes up to about  there.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: which brings us back, of course, to Greelys theory of dominance.  Okay, that-thats all for today. Oh, uh does anyone know where the Freeman building is?

lines.text: Okay. All right, stand up.  Well, when were at the door, I lightly press my lips against his, and then move into his body just for a second, and then I make this sound, "Hmmm." Okay, I know it doesnt sound like anything, but I swear it works.

lines.text: Yeah!!!! Yes, I made it! Im on time!  Okay, why dont we all uh,  open our books to page 23. Where  Where you will see a uh a bunch of uh red spots. Okay,  umm, why dont, why dont you all start to read, while I

lines.text: No-no! Im fine. Its just Hey, can I ask you something? Have you ever looked at someone that youve known for a while and then suddenly suddenly see them a different way?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, that thats exactly it. Youre right. Yeah.

lines.text: Ew, yknow what? One time I saw this guy from behind and he seemed like a totally normal guy and then he turned around and it was Stephan Baldwin!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ooh! Yeah. So yeah, so you know exactly what Im talking about.

lines.speaker: joey's date

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh uh, okay. Yeah.

lines.speaker: rachel

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay.  Okay, thats him! Thats him! Thats Cujo! Thats Cujo!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God .Whats he gonna do now? I cant watch!  Oh. Seriously, how can you watch this? Arent you scared?

lines.text: So is everybody here? I got here a little early myself. Let us begin. Now, the hydrosaurids have been unearthed in two main locations.  Here.  Here.  Now as for the hydrosaurs

lines.text: All right. Its a new day. All that stuff about Rachel, you dont feel that now. It was crazy! Youre fine. Youre better than fine! You are, as your friend Tony would say, Grrrreat! Everythings normal! Shes just your friend Rachel! Your friend Rachel. Your friend! Rachel.

lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh my God, whats up?!

lines.speaker: chandler

lines.text: Yes. When Monica and I were in London, we were both in London.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You know what? This is a bad idea. Forget it. Forget it, and listen, do me a favor, this conversation was between you and me.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: If that.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi! Oh, Ross, dont forget, we have that doctors appointment tomorrow!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey, are you going to find out the sex of the baby?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No-no, we talked about it. We dont want to know. All we care about is that its happy and healthy.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yep! Happy and healthy! And cute!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: And smart!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Popular.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: With an aptitude for science.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Are you two talking about the same baby? Hey! Have you started off thinking of names yet?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh yeah! Ive come up with a bunch of ideas!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Really? Me too!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Me too!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Really?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh huh! If its a girl, Phoebe, and if its a boy, Phoebo!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Maybe. But it wouldnt hurt to have a backup, you know? Uh, Rach-Rach, what were you thinking?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay! I was thinking if its a girl, how about Sandrine? Its French.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Huh. Thats a really pretty name for-for an industrial solvent.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay fine, what do you have?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, OK, its for a boy. Well, I know its a little out there, but Darwin.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wow, oh my God, our child will be beaten to death in the schoolyard.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, by Sandrine.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Youre just saying that 'cause I said no to your name!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im really, really not.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: How-how about you each get five vetoes?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: All right.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: That sounds fair.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah! I dont think youre going to need it though. Okay, check this out. If its a girl, Rain.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Veto.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Rain? Hi. Hi, my name is Rain. I have my own kiln, and my dress is made out of wheat.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I know her! I bought homemade soap from her at a Dead show!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, how about, for a guy, Thatcher?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ross, why do you hate our child?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Fine, you go.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, James.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Huh.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: But only if its a girl.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, veto. How aboutOoh, I like Ruth! What about Ruth?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh! Im sorry! Are we having an 89-year-old? How about Dayton?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Veto. Stewart?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Veto. Sawyer?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Veto. Helen?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Veto.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Is it me, or is veto starting to sound really good?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Boy, do I have a surprise for you!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Sex on the balcony?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No, but someones really not going to get over that idea, are they?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What is it?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I drew you a bath!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Honey, I dont like baths! Could you draw me a picture of us having sex on the balcony?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Please, could you just try it for me? Come on, I used all my best stuff! I-I-I lit some candles. I put on some music. I used bath salts, plus bubble bath! And got you this little plastic Navy ship. So its a boy bath!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, this does butch it up a bit.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I swear, if you try it, you will love it!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right, if I do this, can we at least discuss sex on the balcony?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Absolutely.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Bet I know how that discussions going to go.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right, this isnt so bad. I like the flower smell! Which is okay, because Ive got my boat.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: So?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh my God.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I told you you were a bath person! Hey, when you get out, maybe I can give you a facial!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im going to need a bigger boat.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I dont think you had an open mind about the name Ruth. I mean, come on, little Ruthie Geller, how-how cute is that?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, oh my God! I can practically hear the mahjong tiles!

lines.speaker: dr. long
lines.text: Okay! All your tests look fine. Now, are you two interested in knowing the sex of the baby?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh, no. No, were not.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: But you have it right there in that file? You could tell us whether its a boy or a girl? Dayton or Sandrine? Phoebe or Phoebo?

lines.speaker: dr. long
lines.text: Thats right. But if you dont want to know

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, no, we want to wait, right?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Right. Right.

lines.speaker: dr. long
lines.text: Oh, Ill be right back. And, uh, I know its really not my place, but please dont name your child Phoebo.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So, which of these babies do you think is the ugliest?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What? Rach! Come on, thats terrible! Theyre uh theyre babies. Theyre-theyre all beautiful.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Third one from the left?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, why is it staring at me? I think it knows Im talking about it.  Dont-dont youWhWhaHey!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Youre looking!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I didnt!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I saw you!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay fine, I did. But I didnt see anything, I swear.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Shame on you! Ugly baby judges you!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, but Ross just listen to me

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, no, no, no! Dont tell me! I dont want to know!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: But I couldnt even if I wanted to, because I dont know! I swear; I didnt see anything, and I dont want to know! It was just a momentary lapse.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Momentary lapse. Dont-dont you have any self-control?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, a couple months late on the lecture, Ross.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im in the bathroom, can you come in here? I think theres something wrong.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You know what? I-I think Ill wait out here.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im in the bathtub.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh.  Whats wrong?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I drew my own bath, but I did it wrong! The waters tepid. The salt didnt dissolve and is now lodged places. And the scents I used dont compliment each other. Eucalyptus and chamomileOh!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: The bath salts! Theyre starting to effervesce! Its different.  Its interesting.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, lets talk about something else.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah! Sure, sure. So, what was going on with you today? Oh-oh-oh!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, I actually had the weirdest conversation with Joey. He was talking about rules and right and wrong and

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I had the exact same conversation.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You did? What was he talking about?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I dont know! Joey hasnt had this much trouble getting out words since we saw him in Macbeth!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: That was a long night.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right, lets break this down. What exactly did he say to you?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, he was talking about rules.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Umm, and looking at people differently.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: He didnt say anything about that to me.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What did he tell you?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: He was asking all these questions about you, me, and London. And, of course the glue that holds this all together, the rules.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay. So you, me and London. Looking at people differently. Maybe he wants to do what you and I did in London with someone.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: But what did he mean by rules?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wait a minute! He stopped talking the minute Phoebe came in!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Because he was looking at her differently.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: And Phoebe is his friend, so he thinks that would be breaking the rules!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: My God! He wants to do it with Phoebe in London!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You guys?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Just a minute!  Thats Mrs. Tribbiani!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You dont say anything.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Why would I say anything? That two of our best friends could start the greatest love affair of their lives! And they would have me to thank, and we could all start having babies?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im not going to let you say anything.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You just stay here!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, God!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, hey, Monica, I brought back your iron.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, you had that?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I thought I lost it. I got a new one, like, a month ago.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, just as well, I broke this one.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I mean, I-I, I really shouldnt say. I mean, Im really not supposed to.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Fine.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Its a humdinger!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Then its really too bad that you cant tell me.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Somebody likes you!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Is it Chandler?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, then tell him to stop staring!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Its Joey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Really?! Joey?! You dont say.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Is it something youd be interested in?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I dont know, I dont know, I dont know. You know, I mean, on the one hand, Mother may I? But yknow on the other hand No. No, I cant. Were friends. No, oh, no. I dont want to risk what we have.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I guess that makes sense. So, you think youre going to talk to him?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Sure, yeah. I mean, its Joey. I dont want him to get hurt. Well, I must say, I am on fire! First Chandler, now Joey!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Not Chandler, just Joey.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Sure.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You know what? Ive been thinking about it. Im really coming around on the name Ruth. I think I would actually consider naming our child that.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Rach, I-I cant tell you how-how much that means to me! Ohh Wait a minute. Wait a minute. You-you hated the name Ruth! Why-why would you change your mind? Unless, you know were never going to have to use it. You did see the folder. You know its a boy!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I didnt see anything! I actually changed my mind about the name.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I dont think so! Youre just giving me Ruth so youll get to name it when its a boy, and thats when youll swoop in and name him Heath or Blaine or Sequoia.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I wouldSequoia?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Veto.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Fine.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Unless  You anticipated that I would figure all this out and you know that it actually is a girl, and you really do want her to be named Ruth! Well, Im not falling for that! Okay? Ruth is off the table!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: But Ross, you want the name Ruth!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Not like this!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey. Well, whats up?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Umm, Joey, I know.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I knooow.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Whaaat?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I know about your feelings.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh my God. You do?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes, and Im sorry. I-I know things worked out for Chandler and Monica, but thats very rare.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I know. I know. And this is so much more complicated than it was for those guys. I mean, its Rachel for God sakes.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: For God sakes, its Rachel!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I know. I know. And shes not only my friend; shes my pregnant friend! Shes my pregnant friend whos Ross ex!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah thats Rachel.  Beat me over the head with it.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What am I going to do? You know, and I keep, I keep trying to get rid of these feelings, yknow? I stayed up all last night and made a list of everything I dont like about her. You want to hear it?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: She made me switch to light Mayo. Thats it! Thats all I got! And, you know what? It tastes the same and my pants fit better!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Joey, I just think youre getting worked up over nothing. This is probably just a crush.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You think?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Absolutely! Yknow, you get this rush of feelings, but then it goes away.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, just a crush! Thats all this is! Its a crush! Im Joey; I dont get deep feelings.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Thats right, there you go! Crushes happen all the time! I know Ive had them for all you guys. Well, except for Ross and Chandler. And Im sure youve had them for us.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Not really.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Mm-hmm.  Throw me a bone here.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So, I uh I called the doctor and now we both know the sex of the baby.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thats right. The student has become the master.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ross, I swear, I dont know.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, come on, you know its a girl!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: A what?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You really didnt know?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Were having a girl?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thats what you just said!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You said girl!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yes. Im Im sorry. Im so sorry.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im not! Were having a girl! Sometimes I cant believe its with youBut still! Were having a girl!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I know! I know. You know what? Im putting Ruth back on the table!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, yes! Well have ourselves a little baby Ruth

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Permission to veto.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yes, please.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Do I smell essential oils?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, Im going to take a bath. Im just going to get a magazine.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What do you think youre doing?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: L-leaving my troubles behind?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know that youre new at this, but this is completely unacceptable bath decorum.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, its so hard to care when youre this relaxed.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Fine, you can have the bath, but I am taking your boat. Now youre just a girl in a tub!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hi, Bubbles. Manly. Well, I just thought I would drop by and let you know how it went with Joey.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You told her?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: She pulled it out of me! Shes like a conversational wizard! Howd it go?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, you were wrong, he doesnt like me!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah! How would you like it if I sent you to Lee Majors house and told you that he liked you, and you went down there and you found out that he didnt like you? How would you feel?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I dont think Id care.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Really? Lee Majors is hot!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Were in the bathroom!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Because its a relaxing and enjoyable time!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What are you guys doing in here?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God! A friend hes looking at differently, but its wrong. Its Rachel!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You like Rachel?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Its no big deal, okay? Phoebe and I talked about it. Its just a crush! Its going to go away!  Dude, you gotta rearrange your bubbles! Oh!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Mazel tov.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey! Ross and I were looking for you! What are we all doing in here?  Oh, my!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Honey, cover it up with the boat!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes were all in here and we would love for you to join us!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well hey! Whats going on? Ooh, cool boatOh, no.   Hey, did you, did you tell them?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, I was waiting for you!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Tell us what?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Were having a girl.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Oh, wow! Yay! Wow! Hooray! Oh, man!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ill Ill get you later!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right. Its a new day, and its just a crush, thats all! Just a little crush! All that worrying I was doing, that was crazy. Crazy! Like my friend here the bird would say, "it was cuckoo!" Everythings going to be fine. Its just a crush.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi, sweetie.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I love you.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: It sure is nice to do this together, isnt it?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah. And what youre doing feels so good.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Im not touching you.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Youre not?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Its the salts.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, sweet Lord. New realms of pleasure!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Whatever keeps you off the balcony, big guy!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, whats up?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, I left my guitar here again.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, okay. No problem.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Here you go.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Great! Umm

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So do you want to hang out or something?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe! You kinda caught me at a bad time.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh are you and Chandler

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yes! Exactly.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay. Do you guys want me to play for you?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey Pheebs, whats up?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You ask an intriguing question Chandler Bing.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh my God! Youre getting a massage! You never let me massage you!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe, I can explain!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You told me you hate massages!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Buy stamps, pick up dry cleaning Dont let Phoebe in.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I cant believe this! How long as this been going on?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well umm, Alexandra has been

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, it has a name?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe, dont get upset!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: OkayOop! Too late! Im leaving! Come on Chandler lets go!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, Phoebe I thought IdYeah, what the hell.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh okay, okay! One more push! One more push! Come on honey, were almost there! Were almost there!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh Joey, Im so happy things worked out for us that were having this baby together. I love you so much.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, I love you too.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And I hope its not an inappropriate time to say this but, youre the best sex I ever had.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thats always appropriate!  Oh, okay. One more push! One more push!

lines.speaker: doctor

lines.text: Can I just say, I really admire what youre doing. Just raising her all alone.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, Im not doing it alone. I have Ross.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh, sure. Now. But what happens when he meets somebody else and gets married?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well then he gets a divorce, its Ross!

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Im telling you Rachel, listen to Janice. They all say theyre gonna be there until they start their real family.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well IThats never gonna happen with Ross.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh well thats what I thought about my first husband, now Im lucky if my kid gets to spend the weekend with her father and the twins and little Ms. New Boobs.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: I hate to be the one to say it, but honey you two  are on your own.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well Thats yknowThatsWeve been alone for the last twenty minutes were doing okay. Besides yknow what? I-IMaybe we wont be alone, cause lately I-Ithings have been happening between me and Ross, yknow? Right before I went into labor, we-we had this kiss. Yknow? So it might be the the beginning of something.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey Janice!

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh hi!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Whos this little guy?

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Say hello to Aaron, your future son-in-law.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No-no. No.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Im gonna leave the three of you alone.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Man! Did you see the kid on that nose?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Uh-huh.  Yknow what I was, I was thinking about?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Umm that kiss before we left the apartment. That was some-something huh?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, it really was. But we we gotta be careful. We we cant let that happen again, yknow?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I mean we dont want to go down that road do we?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No! No, of course not. No. Thats why I brought it up.  They didnt have any sodas?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God! Im sorry, I was talking to this nurse, completely forgot.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thats all right.  And so it begins.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Is she in there?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah. Shes putting her down now, thats her.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look at Emma!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I just cant decide who she looks more alike, you or Rachel?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh what are you kidding? Shes gorgeous, its all Rachel.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Im sorry, for the last time, why arent you two together again?  No, I know. I know, because youre not in that place. Which would be fine, except you totally are.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Its its complicated okay?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah thats true. Yeah, you love her. You always have. You have a child together. There is no right answer.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look, weve been together. Okay? And then apart, and then together, and then apart, and now we have a baby.  Its just if-if we got together again and it didnt work out I could never do that to Emma. I mean she-she thinking everything Oh thats now me. What do they put something in the water in this place? Since Rachel and I were doing really, were doing really well right now.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I know. I know. I know. I know, and if you try to make it more you might wreck it.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, exactly.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Right.  Or you might get everything youve wanted since you were fifteen.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey. I just saw a woman breast feeding both of her twins at the same time; it is like a freak show up here.  Whats the matter?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What is it? Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Really its nothing. Im just

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Rach come on, what?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ive just been thinking about how my baby and I are gonna be all alone.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What are you talking about alone? What about Ross?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh please, hell be with his real family, the twins and little miss new boobs.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, how long was I watching that woman?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im just saying that yknow, someday Ross is gonna meet somebody and hes gonna have his own life. Right?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, I guess so.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I just never thought I would raise this baby all by myself. Pretty dumb huh?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, listen to me, listen to me you are never ever gonna be alone. Okay? I promise thats not gonna happen.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey. Honey what would I do without you?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You dont have to worry about that okay?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, hon can you grab me my other box of tissues? Theyre right on that chair under Rosss coat.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Sure.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: My God.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God.  Okay.

lines.speaker: {transcribers note
lines.text: As with all the cliffhangers, there was no credits scene. There will be a ninth and final season of Friends starting sometime in September. See you then, have a good summer everyone.}
